title: Okta Support System Hacked, Sensitive Customer Data Stolen
description:
Okta warns that hackers broke into its support case management system and stole sensitive data that can be used to impersonate valid users.

The post Okta Support System Hacked, Sensitive Customer Data Stolen appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: In Other News: Energy Services Firm Hacked, Tech CEO Gets Prison Time, X Glitch Leads to CIA Channel Hijack
description:
Summary of notable cybersecurity news stories that may be top headlines, but are important for the week of October 16, 2023.

The post In Other News: Energy Services Firm Hacked, Tech CEO Gets Prison Time, X Glitch Leads to CIA Channel Hijack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Philippine Military Ordered to Stop Using Artificial Intelligence Apps Due to Security Risks
description:
The Philippine defense chief ordered the 163,000-member military to stop using applications that harness AI to generate personal portraits, saying they could pose security risks.

The post Philippine Military Ordered to Stop Using Artificial Intelligence Apps Due to Security Risks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Authorities Seize Control of RagnarLocker Ransomware Dark Web Site
description:
The RagnarLocker ransomware group’s dark web leak site has been seized in a coordinated law enforcement operation.

The post Authorities Seize Control of RagnarLocker Ransomware Dark Web Site appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Fraud Detection Firm Spec Raises $15 Million
description:
Silicon Valley fraud detection startup attracts $15 million in new financing from SignalFire, Legion Capital and Rally Ventures.

The post Fraud Detection Firm Spec Raises $15 Million appeared first on SecurityWeek.

title: Iranian Hackers Lurked for 8 Months in Government Network
description:
Iran-linked hacking group Crambus spent eight months inside a compromised network of a Middle Eastern government, Broadcom’s Symantec cybersecurity unit reports.

The post Iranian Hackers Lurked for 8 Months in Government Network appeared first on SecurityWeek.
